jobs.description: Gong transforms revenue organizations by harnessing customer interactions to increase business efficiency, improve decision making and accelerate revenue growth. The Revenue Intelligence Platform uses proprietary artificial intelligence technology to enable teams to capture, understand and act on all customer interactions in a single, integrated platform. More than 4,000 companies around the world rely on Gong to support their go to market strategies and grow revenue efficiently. For more information, visit www.gong.io. Gong is seeking an experienced and strategic Senior Manager of Solution Marketing to support the positioning, messaging, and go to market strategies for our enterprise software solutions. This role will define and execute marketing strategies that resonate with specific audiences, including target personas, industries, market segments, and existing customers. The ideal candidate will have an understanding of B2B enterprise software and a proven track record of crafting compelling narratives that drive customer engagement and market success. Responsibilities Deep Customer Knowledge: Use market research, product analysis, customer interviews, and other resources to become experts on our buyers' needs, goals, motivations and technology requirements. Market Research & Competitive Analysis: Conduct ongoing market research to identify trends, opportunities, and competitive threats. Use insights to inform product positioning, marketing strategies, and product development. Audience Centric Marketing: Develop and execute marketing strategies tailored to specific personas, industries, market segments, and existing customers. Ensure messaging aligns with the needs and pain points of the target audience to drive engagement and conversion. Solution Positioning & Messaging: Craft clear, compelling positioning and messaging for our solutions that differentiate us in the market. Work closely with Product, Sales, and Customer Success teams to ensure alignment and consistency across all touchpoints. Go to Market Strategy (GTM): Lead the development and execution of GTM strategies for new product launches, feature releases, and solution enhancements. Collaborate with cross functional teams to ensure successful market entry and ongoing adoption. Content and Sales Tool Development: Oversee the creation of high impact content that supports marketing efforts, including demos, white papers, assessment tools, webinars, blogs, videos, infographics, and more. Ensure content is aligned with the needs of target audiences and reflects the brand voice. Sales Enablement: Partner with sales teams to develop effective tools, training, and content that empower them to communicate the value of our solutions to prospects and customers. Create and deliver presentations, sales collateral, and case studies that showcase customer success and ROI. Product Strategy Influence: champion our customers’ needs to inform product strategy and roadmap to better service our target audience. Work with the Product team to validate new product hypotheses and create GTM motions that can scale. Demand Generation and Customer Expansion Support: Execute strategies to market to existing customers, driving upsell, cross sell, and renewal opportunities. Collaborate with Growth Marketing and Partner Marketing teams to drive product adoption, upsell, and expansion of new and existing features. Cross Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Product, GTM, Marketing, and other teams to ensure alignment on messaging, campaigns, and overall marketing strategy. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field. MBA or advanced degree preferred. 10+ years of experience in B2B marketing, with at least 5 years in a solution marketing role within an enterprise software company. Strong understanding of enterprise software markets, including key industries, personas, and competitive landscape. Experience in GTM strategy, sales enablement, and product positioning. Proven track record of successfully developing and executing audience centric marketing strategies. Ability to conduct market research and competitive analysis to inform marketing strategies. Strong project management skills with the ability to drive execution from start to finish. Preference to SF Bay Area, but open to other locations. jobs.description: C3.ai, Inc. (NYSE:AI) is a leading Enterprise AI software provider for accelerating digital transformation. The proven C3 AI Platform provides comprehensive services to build enterprise scale AI applications more efficiently and cost effectively than alternative approaches. The C3 AI Platform supports the value chain in any industry with prebuilt, configurable, high value AI applications for reliability, fraud detection, sensor network health, supply network optimization, energy management, anti money laundering, and customer engagement. Learn more at: C3 AI The Product Marketing organization is responsible for outbound and commercial aspects of C3 AI's products. Product Marketing interacts with C3 AI’s existing and prospective customers to bring the voice of our customers to our product roadmap; help drive product strategy; develop product messaging and positioning; enable sales with a robust portfolio of content; develop messages to support our GTM; help craft product pricing; engage with analysts; and work with marketing to run effective customer engagement and awareness campaigns. Product Marketing is vital to growing C3 AI’s business, influencing the product roadmap, supporting sales efforts with marketing collateral, and ultimately growing the Asset Performance Product Suite revenue. Asset Performance Suite is one of the fastest growing parts of C3 AI. As a Product Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for how C3 AI’s Asset Performance products and tools are positioned. You will live the customer journey, help us define future innovation, identify and execute on market opportunities, build stories to help us engage current and future customers for long term success, all while differentiating us from the competition. Your impact will touch all parts of the company and help us fuel our growth across industries and buyers. Our ideal candidate is a creative thinker with analytic and problem solving capabilities, compelling storyteller, and able to transform complex needs and solutions into simple differentiated messages, while also having a passion for people demonstrated by engaging cross functionally to deliver sophisticated products and solutions. Responsibilities Develop a deep understanding of Asset Performance products and C3 AI Platform. Must be able to train other C3 AI teams (Sales, Pre Sales, etc.) on the products. Develop, own, and maintain training materials. Partner with Product Management to define market opportunity and influence roadmap priorities. Form opinions on the existing and potential roadmaps and advocate for specific roadmap components based on market research. Develop and track key business metrics for your products, evaluating the state of your business. Create and execute go to market plans for product launches and new releases. The GTM activities may include campaigns, webinars, updated content, etc. Develop compelling, easy to understand, comprehensive external product content (including proactively) to support sales and GTM efforts. The content may include data sheets and product case studies, website content, blogs, webinars, solution guides, product launches, competitive analysis, etc. The content may showcase existing products as well as new products. Act as a trusted advisor and maintain relationships with Product, customer facing teams (Solutions, Services), Sales, Pre sales. Develop bilateral communication channels to discover the voice of customer (and incorporate it into the marketing collateral) as well as share out new work and materials. Work with Marketing and other teams to enable appropriate product positioning and product materials on the C3 AI website; and run appropriate campaigns to create product awareness. Present with authority at industry conferences, panels, webinars, and customers and internal events. Work with Sales and Pre sales to inspire, motivate and ultimately win customer business through the sales cycle; meet and interact with customers through the sales cycle. Occasional travel might be required (less than 10%). Qualifications Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or similar field. Master of Business Administration (MBA) preferred. 4+ years of experience delivering compelling product marketing results and product revenue growth. Excellent verbal and written communication, and presentation skills. Ability to juggle projects simultaneously, working both independently and collaboratively across diverse teams. Demonstrable domain expertise in any of the following: digital content generation, enterprise sales collateral, enterprise go to market strategies, AI based application development, or digital marketing and targeting. Experience managing and developing new product marketing programs with clear data driven results. Experience managing product positioning, competitive analysis, and product pricing. Ability to develop product strategy and execute against strategic plans. Experience collaborating effectively with both sales and product management to achieve results. Demonstrated success in driving successful customer engagement leading to customer advocacy and partnership. Experience working with demand generation to evaluate business data to deliver high converting programs that result in revenue. Candidates must be authorized to work in the United States without the need for current or future company sponsorship. C3 AI provides excellent benefits, a competitive compensation package and generous equity plan. California Pay Range $130,000—$170,000 USD C3 AI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of any legally protected characteristics, including disabled and veteran status. show less

Who We Are Moveworks is the universal AI copilot for search and automation across all your business applications. We give employees one place to go to find information and get support while reducing costs for your business. The Moveworks Copilot is powered by an industry leading Reasoning Engine that uses a combination of public and proprietary language models to understand employee queries, then build and execute multi step plans that achieve them. It does this by linking into systems (like ITSM, HRIS, ERP, identity management, and more) with native and custom built integrations that turn natural language into powerful automations for employees. The world’s most innovative brands like Databricks, Broadcom, Hearst, and Palo Alto Networks trust Moveworks to eliminate repetitive support issues, deliver instant knowledge, and empower employees to work faster across applications. Founded in 2016, Moveworks has raised $315 million in funding, at a valuation of $2.1 billion, thanks to our award winning product and team. In 2023, we were included in the Forbes Cloud 100 list as well as the Forbes AI 50 for the fifth consecutive year. We were also recognized by the 2023 Edison Awards for AI Optimized Productivity, and were included on Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies list for 2024! Moveworks has over 500 employees in six offices around the world, and is backed by some of the world's most prominent investors, including Kleiner Perkins, Lightspeed, Bain Capital Ventures, Sapphire Ventures, Iconiq, and more. Come join one of the most innovative teams on the planet! Location: Mountain View, CA (In Office ~3 days a week) What You Will Do Be at the forefront with our Demand Gen team! Our dynamic team is the driving force behind Moveworks's revenue acceleration. At the heart of our mission, we recognize there's no single playbook for growth. That's why we're on the hunt for an innovative, driven individual who not only embraces this growth mindset but is armed with the rich experience required for this exciting journey ahead. Craft overarching growth strategies for our digital platforms, ensuring alignment with the organization's objectives for pipeline and revenue generation. Lead the strategic planning and implementation across various paid social platforms including LinkedIn, Meta, Quora, Twitter, and G2. Collaborate across departments—such as Product Marketing, Content, Integrated Campaigns, ABM, Search Team, and Sales—to deepen understanding of our personas and Ideal Customer Profile (ICP) and to drive optimal channel performance. Execute detailed audience research and build channel targeting strategies. Work closely with our Content and Creative teams to produce compelling assets optimized for all devices and formats. Partner with Web and Marketing Ops to refine landing pages to enhance user engagement. Measure, analyze, and share insights and actionable recommendations with key stakeholders. Allocate and manage budget efficiently, ensuring that resources are invested in high ROI channels and tactics. Stay abreast of emerging marketing channels and technologies, experimenting with new platforms and tools What You Bring To The Table 5+ years of experience in digital performance marketing in a fast paced B2B SaaS environment. Strong understanding of B2B sales process and customer lifecycle Obsessed with B2B marketing and eager to experiment with new growth strategies. Proven track record of driving growth in the channels such as LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, Google, YouTube, Quora, Twitter, G2, etc. Strong ownership & growth mindset: embracing challenges with a growth mentality and openness to feedback. Skilled in proactive, effective communication, coordinating resources to ensure seamless operations. Data driven with a consumer first focus. You have a strong track record of using analytics to provide strategic recommendations and drive growth. Strong copywriting skills. Results driven mindset, with a strong ability to analyze quantitative data to forecast impact, determine program effectiveness, and measure ROI Experience and passion for working in a fast paced, high growth environment, with a focus on transparency, collaboration, rapid iteration, and continuous improvement Compensation Range: $130,000 $183,000 Our compensation package includes a market competitive salary, equity for all full time roles, exceptional benefits, and, for applicable roles, commissions or bonus plans. Ultimately, in determining pay, final offers may vary from the amount listed based on geography, the role’s scope and complexity, the candidate’s experience and expertise, and other factors. jobs.job_title: Sr Product Marketing Manager - Competitive Intelligence
jobs.description: With Confluent, organizations can harness the full power of continuously flowing data to innovate and win in the modern digital world. We have a purpose that drives us to do better every day – we're creating an entirely new category within data infrastructure data streaming. This technology will allow every organization to create experiences and use the power of data in ways that profoundly impact the way we all live. This impact is our purpose and drives us to do better every day. One Confluent. One team. One Data Streaming Platform. Data Connects Us. About The Role As a Product Marketing Manager focusing on Competitive Intelligence at Confluent, you will play a crucial role in shaping our product marketing strategies and enabling our sales teams by providing deep insights into market trends, competitor strategies, and customer needs within the data infrastructure space. Your work will directly influence product development, go to market strategies, ensuring our product positioning is compelling, differentiated, and effectively communicated to our target audiences. What You Will Do Competitive Intelligence: Conduct thorough market research and competitive analysis to identify trends, opportunities, and threats. Develop a comprehensive understanding of competitor products, pricing, marketing strategies, and sales tactics. Provide regular updates to internal stakeholders on market developments and recommend strategic responses. Content Development: Craft compelling messaging and positioning documents that clearly differentiate our products in the market. Develop a range of marketing materials, including white papers, case studies, blog posts, and sales enablement tools, that articulate the value proposition of our solutions. Cross functional Collaboration: Work closely with product management, sales, and marketing teams to communicate competitive insights and develop strategies that effectively counter competitive threats. Provide training and support to sales teams, equipping them with the knowledge and tools to effectively compete in the marketplace. Win/Loss Interview And Analysis: Conduct win/loss interviews and quarterly win/loss analysis to gather insights on our competitive positioning, product strengths and weaknesses, and market opportunities for improvement. Performance Measurement: Monitor and report on the effectiveness of competitive strategies, making recommendations for continuous improvement. What You Will Bring 5+ years of experience in enterprise software (subscription and/or SaaS/Cloud) GTM; Product Marketing, Competitive Intelligence, Product Management, or top tier Management Consulting experience preferred. Strong technical foundation or ability to pick up and understand product/tech concepts (e.g., engineering degree and/or product experience). Distinctive problem solving, strategic, and analytical capabilities (Excel / Google Sheets required, SQL / Tableau / BigQuery nice to have). Excellent communication and presentation skills, capable of conveying complex information clearly and persuasively. Thrive in cross functional environments and can effectively collaborate with a wide range of stakeholders and teams. Are highly organized, efficient, and proactive—you take on complex projects, drive them forward with unwavering ownership, and ensure no detail is overlooked or task left unfinished. What Gives You An Edge Experience with Apache Kafka, data architecture, cloud services, or distributed systems. Come As You Are At Confluent, equality is a core tenet of our culture. We are committed to building an inclusive global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences. The more diverse we are, the richer our community and the broader our impact. Employment decisions are made on the basis of job related criteria without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law. At Confluent, we are committed to providing competitive pay and benefits that are in line with industry standards. We analyze and carefully consider several factors when determining compensation, including work history, education, professional experience, and location. This position has an annual estimated salary of $141,600 $185,000, an annual bonus, and a competitive equity package. The actual pay may vary depending on your skills, qualifications, experience, and work location. In addition, Confluent offers a wide range of employee benefits. jobs.description: Who We Are Verkada is a leader in cloud based B2B physical security. Verkada offers six product lines — video security cameras, access control, environmental sensors, alarms, workplace and intercoms — integrated with a single cloud based software platform. Designed with simplicity and scalability in mind, Verkada gives organizations the real time insight to know what could impact the safety and comfort of people throughout their physical environment, while empowering them to take immediate action to minimize security risks, workplace frustrations and costly inefficiencies. Founded in 2016 with more than $460M in funding raised to date, Verkada has expanded rapidly with 15 offices across three continents, 2,100+ full time employees and 28,000+ customers across 70+ countries. As a Growth Manager, you'll be joining a highly selective team with educational backgrounds from Stanford, Princeton, MIT, and more, with a wide variety of career experience across investment banking, corporate strategy, previous start up experience. The common link between all of us is that we like to have an impact and solve problems. You'll drive pipeline generation and acquisition strategy for Verkada’s core product suites within the U.S. market. You will play a pivotal role in building account based marketing (ABM) for enterprise and global accounts. You will get a large set of accounts that are of strategic importance to Verkada's growth. You will be in charge of the budget and the entire strategy to help our sales team win these logos. Scalable Infrastructure: Design and manage a scalable, repeatable framework for automated and ABM campaigns. Ensure seamless execution across multiple marketing channels to maximize impact and performance. Audience & Data Strategy: Own the data strategy for audience segmentation, intent signal identification, and the optimization of demand capture programs. Leverage data to create highly targeted marketing efforts that drive engagement and conversions. Campaign Execution & Optimization: Manage the full lifecycle of marketing campaigns—from planning to execution to performance analysis. Strong understanding of ABM strategies, tapping into multiple channels digital and outbound (webinars, direct mail, email, content syndication). Demonstrated ability to collaborate cross functionally with sales, marketing operations and product teams. Proficiency in data analysis, knowledge of SQL and Excel preferred. Experience managing large scale marketing campaigns and optimizing performance. jobs.description: At Anaplan, we are a team of innovators who are focused on optimizing business decision making through our leading scenario planning and analysis platform so our customers can outpace their competition and the market. What unites Anaplanners across teams and geographies is our collective commitment to our customers’ success and to our Winning Culture. Our customers rank among the who’s who in the Fortune 50. Coca Cola, LinkedIn, Adobe, LVMH and Bayer are just a few of the 2,400+ global companies that rely on our best in class platform. Our Winning Culture is the engine that drives our teams of innovators. We champion diversity of thought and ideas, we behave like leaders regardless of title, we are committed to achieving ambitious goals and we have fun celebrating our wins. Supported by operating principles of being strategy led, values based and disciplined in execution, you’ll be inspired, connected, developed and rewarded here. Everything that makes you unique is welcome; join us and be your best self! We are looking for a self motivated Marketing Manager / Sr. Manager, Supply Chain Solutions and Products (ideally based in our San Francisco, Miami, New York, or Minneapolis office) to contribute as a key stakeholder and to join our growing Industry, Solutions, and Product Marketing team. At Anaplan, we are revolutionizing SCM by transforming the way businesses operate. Our Supply Chain Applications are designed to tackle the most complex challenges, providing real time insights, and enabling data driven decisions that optimize performance and enhance visibility across the entire supply chain. We’re looking for individuals excited to be part of a fast growing company and contribute to the future of Supply Chain, and you will play a pivotal role in supporting and promoting these cutting edge solutions. As a Supply Chain Solution Marketing Manager, you'll be working closely with stakeholders across Product, Sales, GTM Operations, Competitive Intelligence, and Marketing, and you will drive the creation and communication of impactful content highlighting Anaplan’s advantage in supply chain, supporting GTM strategy, and driving the launches of new applications and products. You will create compelling field facing content to drive our marketing and sales programs and be directly responsible for interfacing with our GTM organization. jobs.description: If you are looking for a challenging and exciting career in the world of technology, then look no further. Skyworks is an innovator of high performance analog semiconductors whose solutions are powering the wireless networking revolution. Through our broad technology expertise and one of the most extensive product portfolios in the industry, we are Connecting Everyone and Everything, All the Time. At Skyworks, you will find a fast paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management, and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creative thinking. We value open communication, mutual trust, and respect. We are excited about the opportunity to work with you and glad you want to be part of a team of talented individuals who together are changing the way the world communicates. Requisition ID: 74543 Job Description In this position, you will be joining the successful and energetic Broad Markets Marketing team at Skyworks. You will be responsible for driving one of the IoT market verticals within the Broad Markets organization. The scope of responsibilities includes new product definition, business case generation, external product evangelization, pricing strategy/negotiation, and associated go to market strategies. Additional activities include overall IoT market strategy (Market modeling, tracking segment trends and dynamics, competitive threat analysis and R&D investment recommendations). This is a key position driving our continued growth in the IoT market by expanding our content footprint by leveraging the broad product portfolio of Skyworks. You will work collaboratively with the Sales, Systems Engineering, Application Engineering and internal Business Units to develop winning product roadmaps and associated strategies. Key performance metrics include accretive revenue growth, market share expansion and content diversification. Responsibilities Will Include, But Not Be Limited To Overall market segment strategy and business plan Ensure that product justifications are well researched, justified and structured to gain maximum ROI for Skyworks and market penetration growth Drive product collateral and product support documentation for customer facing activities Set Roadmaps and business direction, be involved in customer / market development activities through a close working relationship with sales activities Defining account strategies for your customer base; driving engagement through the discovery, evaluation, negotiation and design win process Sales Training Material Generation and Presentation Work across corporate functions and business units, as required Qualifications The ideal candidate is a self starter who thrives in a fast paced, dynamic environment with multiple competing priorities and who finds satisfaction in being accountable to accomplishing results quickly and accurately. Experience with RF semiconductor market and working in a global, matrixed organization is preferred. BS or B. Eng in Electrical Engineering or related engineering field, MBA or financial analytics exposure 15 years of related experience with a minimum five years of previous Product Marketing experience Team player mentality & self motivated Strong sense of customer orientation and effectiveness Well versed in RF Technologies (Cellular, WiFi, BT/BLE, GNSS, etc) Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Strong PowerPoint and Excel skills Ability to work well with all levels of internal management and staff, as well as outside clients and vendors, to drive alignment and collaboration Sensitivity to confidential matters Demonstrated ability to confront tough issues and contribute to collaborative solutions Willing to travel ~25% of the time The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is currently USD $139,100 $278,300 per year. Starting base pay will depend on relevant experience and skills, training and education, business needs, market demands, the ultimate job duties and requirements, and work location. Skyworks has different base pay ranges for different work locations in the U.S. Benefits include access to healthcare benefits (including a premium free medical plan option), a 401(k) plan and company match, an employee stock purchase plan, paid time off (including vacation, sick/wellness, parental leave), among others. Employees are eligible to participate in an incentive plan, and certain roles are also eligible for additional awards, including recognition and stock. jobs.description: Siemens EDA, Electronics Board Systems Division, is seeking an experienced professional to join our portfolio unit marketing team. We are looking for a candidate who possesses a unique blend of skills, including product marketing, marketing programs, and exceptional communication abilities, particularly in evangelism and persona targeting. This role will play a crucial part in our wide digital outreach efforts, aimed at expanding Siemens' presence in the printed circuit board software solutions market for SMBs and mid markets. The ideal candidate will have a dynamic and engaging personality, capable of effectively evangelizing Siemens solutions across multiple digital platforms. These platforms include social media, industry portals, and Siemens' own digital properties. The candidate will be responsible for engaging the targeted engineering audience through various media outreach channels, such as videos, blogs, vlogs, and live streams. They should actively seek out platforms that allow them to connect with the intended audience. Additionally, the successful candidate will contribute to the development of marketing messaging, collateral, and programs that drive thought leadership, increase awareness, and support the go to market success of this cross company initiative. To establish credibility, it is preferred that the candidate has hands on experience using PCB software solutions and possesses in depth knowledge of the methodologies and challenges of printed circuit design. While this role is an individual contributor position, it requires a growth mindset and strong team leadership skills to drive programs and foster collaboration across teams. Responsibilities: Advocate and promote Siemens technology to targeted SMBs and mid markets through various platforms, with a focus on digital channels, to increase awareness and drive technology adoption. Create compelling and engaging content, including videos, blogs, articles, tutorials, and other formats, that effectively communicates technical concepts and best practices to the target audience. Build relationships with influencers in the PCB solutions space for the mid market, and foster community building activities to expand awareness of Siemens solutions among the target audience. Collaborate with cross functional teams, including marketing programs, product development, and engineering, to ensure alignment and maintain strong feedback loops between Sales, Field Enablement, and Marketing for effective collateral and messaging. Identify and leverage opportunities for target relevant platforms, both digital and live conferences, to extend communication reach and engage with the targeted audience. Monitor and evaluate progress by tracking and reporting progress to goals, analyzing performance metrics, and making necessary adjustments to optimize results. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university or college, preferably in Electrical Engineering or a related field. 8+ years of experience in product and technical marketing specifically within an engineering software solutions company, with a preference for expertise in electronics development, PCB design, or EDA. Familiarity with the entire PCB development process, including supply chain, design, and manufacturing, is highly desirable. Strong understanding of the electronics ecosystems (suppliers, service providers, manufacturing, etc.) Demonstrated track record of marketing success in comparable roles, including program management, communications, and digital marketing. Ability to thrive in a dynamic environment and work independently to develop and implement new programs and initiatives. Excellent communication and storytelling skills Strong attention to detail and ability to keep things well organized. Proven ability to collaborate with cross functional colleagues and work effectively in a team environment. Mindset oriented towards high growth and ownership of projects and responsibilities. Why us? Working at Siemens Software means flexibility Choosing between working at home and the office at other times is the norm here. We offer great benefits and rewards, as you'd expect from a world leader in industrial software. A collection of over 377,000 minds building the future, one day at a time in over 200 countries. We're dedicated to equality, and we welcome applications that reflect the diversity of the communities we work in. All employment decisions at Siemens are based on qualifications, merit, and business need. Bring your curiosity and creativity and help us shape tomorrow! Siemens Software. Transform the Everyday The salary range for this position is $126,100 to $227,000 and this role is eligible to earn incentive compensation. The actual compensation offered is based on the successful candidate’s work location as well as additional factors, including job related skills, experience, and relevant education/training. jobs.description: BE PART OF BUILDING THE FUTURE. What do NASA and emerging space companies have in common with COVID vaccine R&D teams or with Roblox and the Metaverse? The answer is data, all fast moving, fast growing industries rely on data for a competitive edge in their industries. And the most advanced companies are realizing the full data advantage by partnering with Pure Storage. Pure’s vision is to redefine the storage experience and empower innovators by simplifying how people consume and interact with data. With 11,000+ customers including 58% of the Fortune 500, we’ve only scratched the surface of our ambitions. Pure Is Blazing Trails And Setting Records For ten straight years, Gartner has named Pure a leader in the Magic Quadrant Our customer first culture and unwavering commitment to innovation have earned us a certified Net Promoter Score in the top 1% of B2B companies globally Industry analysts and press applaud Pure’s leadership across these dimensions And, our 5,000+ employees are emboldened to make Pure a faster, stronger, smarter company as we go If you, like us, say “bring it on” to exciting challenges that change the world, we have endless opportunities where you can make your mark. Pure Storage is seeking a Product Marketing Manager to join the Pure Platform marketing team. The Pure Platform provides an industry leading strategy to drive transformative value for customers and partners, built on the industry’s most reliable and consistent storage solution. In this role, you will help drive the enablement and outreach initiatives that expand the reach and impact of the Pure Storage Platform. Working closely with sales, marketing, and partner teams, you’ll contribute to efforts that increase platform visibility and engagement. You will also work with Product Marketing and Campaign teams to support marketing initiatives, developing positioning, messaging, and content that effectively communicate the platform’s ongoing value. You will play a key role within the platform team by supporting the development and maintenance of core content and assisting with product launches, marketing campaigns, and go to market activities. Your efforts will ensure compelling activities and materials are in place to drive the platform’s continued success. SHOULD YOU ACCEPT THIS CHALLENGE... Enablement: Actively engage with Enablement and Product Marketing teams to ensure the Platform continues to have a strong, far reaching influence. Subject Matter Support: Build knowledge of the Pure Platform to become a trusted resource on its features and benefits. Advocacy: Serve as an enthusiastic representative of Pure Storage and the platform, both internally and externally. What You’ll Need To Bring To This Role... Product Marketing Knowledge: Some experience or internship in product marketing, marketing, or solutions marketing, ideally within the technology sector. Collaboration and Influencing Skills: Strong interpersonal skills and a desire to collaborate effectively with cross functional partners, including product management and sales. Educational Background: Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field. Communication Skills: Strong written and verbal communication skills; communicating clearly and effectively with team members and stakeholders. This role is based in Santa Clara, CA. We value unique thoughts and celebrate individuality, and with ample opportunity to learn, develop yourself, and expand into different roles, joining Pure is an investment in your career journey. jobs.description: LiveRamp is the data collaboration platform of choice for the world’s most innovative companies. A groundbreaking leader in consumer privacy, data ethics, and foundational identity, LiveRamp is setting the new standard for building a connected customer view with unmatched clarity and context while protecting precious brand and consumer trust. LiveRamp offers complete flexibility to collaborate wherever data lives to support the widest range of data collaboration use cases—within organizations, between brands, and across its premier global network of top quality partners. Hundreds of global innovators, from iconic consumer brands and tech giants to banks, retailers, and healthcare leaders turn to LiveRamp to build enduring brand and business value by deepening customer engagement and loyalty, activating new partnerships, and maximizing the value of their first party data while staying on the forefront of rapidly evolving compliance and privacy requirements. The Global Lead Product Marketing Manager will lead all marketing efforts for LiveRamp’s Connectivity product portfolio, which includes activation and addressability. You’ll work closely with cross functional teams to lead, develop, and execute go to market strategies. Making the complicated world of marketing and advertising technology easy to understand will be a top priority as you craft compelling, customer first product positioning and messaging. This highly visible role reports to the Sr. Director of Product Marketing and requires a skilled storyteller who can build relationships across teams and drive go to market alignment. You'll also be a subject matter expert in LiveRamp’s Data Connectivity portfolio, developing training and thought leadership. You Will: Develop and execute go to market strategies for new products and features within the Connectivity portfolio, including marketing briefs, positioning and messaging, naming, packaging, client facing roadmaps, and commercial training. Ensure cross functional alignment across product, pricing, marketing, commercial, and data ethics teams to maintain a unified approach to product launches, messaging, and go to market execution. Collaborate with peer PMMs and Solutions Marketers on cross portfolio offerings and messaging. Craft compelling product narratives that address customer and market needs, positioning LiveRamp as a thought leader in the industry. Produce high impact external content across various mediums, including thought leadership, use cases and demos, aligned with key buyer personas and tailored to different stages of the sales funnel. Continually manage your product marketing portfolio across the product lifecycle, ensuring success post launch. Train commercial teams and provide internal educational resources to support understanding and effective selling of your product portfolio. Serve on key LiveRamp initiatives and events like semi annual platform launches and RampUp. Track and report on key product and marketing KPIs to measure success and guide future strategies. About You: Proven B2B/SaaS product marketer with 8+ years of experience in developing breakthrough product positioning and go to market strategies that drive successful marketing execution in fast growth environments. Deep industry knowledge of marketing and advertising industry, with the ability to simplify and translate complex concepts into clear, compelling marketing content. Project management expertise, with strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple initiatives and campaigns simultaneously. Customer centric approach, with a deep understanding of buyer personas, customer journeys, and effective value communication at each stage of the funnel. Experienced in working closely with product management, sales, and marketing teams to drive sales enablement and marketing execution. Strong business acumen, with the ability to understand critical customer challenges and translate product capabilities into meaningful business value. Highly collaborative team player, comfortable in fast paced, dynamic environments. Type S (Startup) personality: smart, ethical, friendly, hardworking, and proactive (no exceptions). Bonus Points: MBA Experience interfacing with a global team Benefits: People: work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do. In Office Food: enjoy catered meals, boundless snacks, and the occasional food truck. Fun: we host in person and virtual events such as game nights, happy hours, camping trips, and sports leagues. Work/Life Harmony: flexible paid time off, options for working from home, and paid parental leave. LiveRamp offers a comprehensive benefits package designed to help you be your best self in your personal and professional lives. Our benefits package offers medical, dental, vision, life and disability, an employee assistance program, voluntary benefits as well as perks programs for your healthy lifestyle, career growth and more. Savings: our 401K matching plan helps you plan ahead. RampRemote: a comprehensive program to assist you in setting up a home office that works for you Location: work in the heart of San Francisco, New York, Little Rock or remote in the US The approximate annual base compensation range is $137,500 to $203,000. The actual offer, reflecting the total compensation package and benefits, will be determined by a number of factors including the applicant's experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, geography, as well as internal equity among our team. More About Us: LiveRamp’s mission is to connect data in ways that matter, and doing so starts with our people. We know that inspired teams enlist people from a blend of backgrounds and experiences. And we know that individuals do their best when they not only bring their full selves to work but feel like they truly belong. jobs.description: At Acorns, our mission is to look after the financial best interests of the up and coming, beginning with the empowering, proud step of micro investing. How do we accomplish our mission? Our values. Lead With Heart With compassion, integrity, and tenacity, inspire yourself and others to move past all previous thresholds of possibility Make Bold Decisions We are creating a new world. Be optimistic, adventurous, and courageous. Leap fearlessly into the future Always Build Trust Say what you mean, mean what you say, and do what you say you’re going to do. We are all owners. We are one team Never Stop Growing Change IS the constant. Stay hungry and curious. Be relentless in the pursuit of progress Find a way Never settle, no excuses, nothing is impossible. Just make it happen Our values guide us, and our mission drives us. Come join us and help deliver financial wellness for the whole family, putting the tools of wealth making into everyone’s hands. ________________________________________________________ Sr. Product Marketing Manager | Acorns Acorns is seeking a Sr. Product Marketing Manager to join our dynamic team. Working cross functionally with Brand, Paid Acquisition, CRM / Lifecycle, Product, and Design, you will activate go to market strategies ranging from awareness campaigns, conversion, cross sell, and up sell for our current financial wellness system of products and new product features. This person should have deep empathy for our customers, a mastery of global go to market strategy, and a proven track record of surpassing business goals. The role reports to the Director of Product Marketing. Acorns is a remote first organization, offering the flexibility to work remotely while providing optional access to office space in Irvine, CA. What you will do at Acorns: Lead the development and execution of Acorns marketing strategy across multiple Acorns new and existing products Build a scalable and maintainable vision for Acorns that determines how we build a better financial wellness system. Translate current and future Acorns customer needs to inform the product messaging, points of differentiation, marketing content, and collateral. Confidently guide reviews and solicit feedback on work during large meetings with senior leadership, fostering open dialogue and ensuring alignment on key initiatives. Execute multiple aspects of product marketing; from product positioning to product launches and strategy, education and engagement campaigns, events, and contests. Measure and report against the performance of product marketing initiatives Develop partnerships with cross functional stakeholders such as acquisition, brand, CRM/Lifecycle, product, design, communications, and customer support. What you will bring to Acorns: 6+ years of consumer facing Product Marketing, Growth Marketing, or Product Management experience; experience in global organizations preferred Experience crafting & implementing customer segmentation based on demographics, attitudes, behaviors, and lifetime value. Demonstrated track record of creating customer segment oriented campaigns to steer new customer acquisition, deepen engagement & retention Advanced quantitative and deductive skills. Ability to distinguish between the signal and the noise and make data guided actions. Outstanding prioritization and project management skills Powerful storyteller: written, verbal, and visual Demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively across multiple teams Self starter and ability to build programs from scratch: be ready to roll up your sleeves and get things done Thirst for delivering game changing products Exceptional drive and precision in delivery A belief that your work is tied to your life's mission Optimistic about the potential of societal change You are not expected to have experience with all listed requirements. If you feel passionate about Acorns' mission, vision, and values, please apply. What we offer: Competitive salary and stock options A comprehensive benefits package for you and your family Flexible work location, hours, and paid time off 401(k) discretionary match Monthly Acorns account contribution & GoHenry account for your family Mindfulness and Financial Wellness resources, Headspace and Addition Wealth Acorns Career Development Program (Ongoing training sessions, development plans, development check ins, Cornerstone’s online training platform) Roots Leadership Program for Emerging Leaders Community week onsite gatherings and various virtual events Talented and motivated team members who care deeply about one another, our mission, and our customers. The rare opportunity to create a new world. We inspire one another every day to do meaningful work that solves big societal challenges. About Acorns: Acorns is a financial wellness app that helps everyday people and families save and invest money for the long term. Since 2014, Acorns has grown into a global company with multiple life stage products serving the needs of kids, teens, adults and parents. Named one of Time’s “World’s Best Brands of 2024,” Acorns has helped over 13 million people save & invest over $22 billion dollars, much of it from spare change and small amounts. Compensation Information: The pay range for this position at commencement of employment is expected to be between $150,000 and $175,000/year; however, base pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job related knowledge, skills, and experience. jobs.description: One of the world’s largest retail organizations is searching for a Senior SEO Manager to lead its SEO team and drive non paid traffic growth across its digital properties 100% Remotely. In this role, you will develop and implement a comprehensive SEO strategy that enhances visibility, improves search performance, and aligns with business objectives. You’ll lead a team of SEO experts, oversee technical and content optimization, and pioneer emerging trends like generative AI and content automation. This exciting position begins as a 3 month, W2 contract opportunity with a 100% remote schedule, competitive benefits, and the potential to extend or convert to permanent employment! Responsibilities: Develop and execute a strategic SEO roadmap to achieve ambitious traffic and revenue goals. Optimize technical SEO, including site architecture, crawlability, and mobile performance. Implement cutting edge content and link building strategies to enhance search rankings. Advocate for SEO best practices and educate internal stakeholders to foster organization wide alignment. Lead cross functional collaborations to integrate SEO with broader marketing and business initiatives. Stay ahead of industry trends, leveraging AI and automation to maintain a competitive edge. Define reporting frameworks, analyze performance metrics, and present insights to leadership. Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree required; advanced degrees are a plus. 10+ years of SEO experience, with a proven track record of driving organic search growth. Expertise in managing technical SEO, content strategies, and international optimization. Strong leadership experience, including managing teams of 5+ and cross functional collaboration. Proficiency in SEO tools, analytics platforms, and emerging digital marketing technologies. Excellent communication skills and the ability to translate technical concepts for diverse audiences. Motion Recruitment Partners is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/vets. All applicants must be currently authorized to work on a full time basis in the country for which they are applying, and no sponsorship is currently available. Join Xylem in the global mission to #LetsSolveWater! As a leading water technology company with 23,000 employees operating in over 150 countries, Xylem is at the forefront of addressing the world's most critical water challenges. We invite passionate individuals to join our team, dedicated to exceeding customer expectations through innovative and sustainable solutions. Xylem is Hiring for a Product Marketing Manager to work a flexible hybrid work schedule form when of our major locations in the US. The Product Marketing Manager is responsible for developing a strategy for existing and new product with measurable KPIs against key performance goals. Work with business development manager(s) and product manager(s) to develop a quantifiable value proposition, messaging and positioning that resonate with target market and buyer persona. Core Responsibilities Lead discovery sessions with internal and external stakeholders to define what a successful product launch looks like Create and execute marketing plans for brand awareness, product application specific marketing, sales and channel enablement. Collaborate with business development and product management in the creation of thought leadership, portfolio content, sales tools, integrated campaigns and advertising. Leads start to finish marketing collateral development for large, complex initiatives from product messaging and positioning to creative briefs, etc., via multi department, multi channel coordination. Track and report on KPIs while providing insights and recommendations to improve results Monitor and report on the success of product launches, adjusting strategies as needed. Gather and analyze VOC to influence product development and marketing strategies. Interpret customer personas and end user insights to tailor marketing efforts. Track and analyze the performance of marketing campaigns related to product launches. Use data driven insights to optimize marketing strategies and improve ROI. Ensure that product marketing campaigns and materials align with vertical business strategies and objectives. Highly organized with strong project and time management skills. Thinks customer first, balanced with keen category foresight and willingness to embrace the large, complex global and regional product launches with excellence. Capable of managing multiple product launches across matrixed departments, leadership levels and distribution channels with influence. Displays analytical and creative ability to translate complex development ideas and technical input into customer facing content. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Business, Marketing, Product/Program Management, or Similar 8 10 years of product management/marketing experience Proven history of product management and marketing success in a product marketing position A desire to collaboration on a high level with internal and external teams, channel partners and vendors Possess a strong technical aptitude to understand product features, competitive gaps/advantages, customer challenges and solve problems Ability to travel 25% High Impact Behaviors Continuous Professional Development: Professionals should be committed to lifelong learning, seeking out opportunities for self improvement, and staying abreast of industry trends and best practices. Collaboration and Teamwork: Effective professionals understand the value of collaboration. They work well with others, contribute to team goals, and understand that diverse perspectives can lead to better solutions. Results Driven Performance: High performing professionals focus on delivering results. They set high standards for their own performance and are committed to achieving objectives efficiently and effectively. Starting pay is dependent on multiple factors, such as skills, experience and work location, and is not typically at the top of the range Salary Range $91,500.00 $164,500.00 Join the global Xylem team to be a part of innovative technology solutions transforming water usage, conservation, and re use. Our products impact public utilities, industrial sectors, residential areas, and commercial buildings, with a commitment to providing smart metering, network technologies, and advanced analytics for water, electric, and gas utilities. Partner with us in creating a world where water challenges are met with ingenuity and dedication; where we recognize the power of diversity, equity and inclusion in driving innovation and allowing us to compete more effectively around the world. At Xylem, you'll not only contribute to solving water issues but also have the chance to make a difference through our paid Volunteer Program, Xylem Watermark. We embrace diversity and prioritize our employees' well being through our DE&I initiatives and Employee Resource Groups (ERG). Proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity (including disability and veterans) and Affirmative Action workplace, Xylem fosters an inclusive environment free from discrimination or harassment. Xylem is dedicated to providing reasonable accommodations to enable all employees to perform their essential job functions. We reserve the right to modify this job description and assign additional duties as needed. Embrace the opportunity to be part of Xylem's transformative journey in shaping the future of water technology! #XylemCareers #GlobalImpact #WaterInnovation show less

jobs.description: At UnitedHealthcare, we’re simplifying the health care experience, creating healthier communities and removing barriers to quality care. The work you do here impacts the lives of millions of people for the better. Come build the health care system of tomorrow, making it more responsive, affordable and equitable. Ready to make a difference? Join us to start Caring. Connecting. Growing together. This role will be responsible for the planning and individual execution of B2B digital display, programmatic and video campaigns. Working closely with internal team members the successful applicant will assist with the strategy, execute the campaign set up, execute campaign optimization and execute reporting the campaigns. You’ll enjoy the flexibility to work remotely * from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges. Primary Responsibilities Development of display, programmatic and Video campaign strategy Execute in platform daily campaign optimization, testing, tracking, builds and performance measurement Management of programs to ensure campaigns are optimally structured, setup, trafficked and are tracking correctly Oversee creative development and approval process Develop and present reporting and key insights on campaign performance Evaluate and improve internal display processes to support strategic planning and implementation e.g., cost files, reporting set up, partner billing and audience setup Skills And Experience Passion for digital marketing with an understanding of the complexity of the digital advertising landscape Constantly learning about the ever changing digital ecosystem with a willingness to test new tools and technologies In platform experience across multiple DSP and Display partner platforms Passionate about results, achieving goals and communicating successes Demonstrated ability to work within tight time constraints, providing near real time insights to team members to ensure targets are achieved Highly analytical with advanced problem solving skills and excellent attention to detail Experience in managing complex media projects across multiple stakeholder groups Understanding of digital direct response marketing tactics and best practices You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in. Required Qualifications 5+ years of in platform executing hands on programmatic/direct partner and paid social experience on either client, agency, agency trading desk or programmatic technology teams Experience managing B2B accounts with understanding of B2B audience activations Experience across Demand Side Platforms (DSPs), Data Management Platforms (DMPs), ad serving and brand safety platforms Experience with data visualization and reporting tools Experience with CRM audience activation platforms Advanced understanding of digital tactics and measurement specializing in display, paid social, video and native advertising utilizing both 1st, 2nd and 3rd party data sources Advanced tracking and analytics knowledge Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills Preferred Qualifications Financial services, insurance and/or technology experience Experience with Adobe Analytics Experience in DOMO and/or Tableau Experience in LiveRamp All employees working remotely will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, Rhode Island, Washington, Washington, D.C. Residents Only: The salary range for this role is $88,000 to $173,200 annually. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to local labor markets, education, work experience, certifications, etc. UnitedHealth Group complies with all minimum wage laws as applicable. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far reaching choice of benefits and incentives. Application Deadline: This will be posted for a minimum of 2 business days or until a sufficient candidate pool has been collected. Job posting may come down early due to volume of applicants. At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes an enterprise priority reflected in our mission. Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. UnitedHealth Group is a drug free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment. show less

FICO (NYSE: FICO) is a leading global analytics software company, helping businesses in 100+ countries make better decisions. Join our world class team today and fulfill your career potential! The Opportunity "AI is a fast moving industry with huge potential for scale, and yet there is also a lot of hype. This role is responsible for conducting market analysis and technical research on market needs and emerging innovations to cut through the noise, and then driving the organization to capitalize on these opportunities. This will also involve playing a lead role in guiding the naming and packaging of our offerings to set up the organization (and our software partners) for success with elegantly written marketing content and collateral that supports these new offerings. We’re looking for smart and motivated people who have a passion to be part of this red hot decision intelligence space and comfort with technology and complex topics. Both FICO’s business and AI are complex and technical problem domains and so this means there will be a lot to get up to speed on, but we have experts on the team who will mentor you and serve as subject matter experts to guide you in your learning and professional development as you develop technical proficiency and eventually grow to achieve excellence. You must have a desire to strive in an environment of independently driven, constant learning and have the intellectual honestly and confidence to understand the difference between when you “know” and when you “think you know” something. You will also need a keen intuition on how to make complex things simple without losing the essence that makes it all work." Hiring Manager What You'll Contribute Perform technical market research involving a variety of research methods (surveys, SME interviews, focus groups, industry analyst briefings, competitive research, reading academic journal papers, etc.) and summarize the results into high impact customer and sales facing content. Lead the naming and branding process we use to align the customer facing names of new, complex and esoteric software and AI offerings that fit into our multi layered capability organization system. Over time, you’ll develop into owning and modernizing the organization system in it’s next generation. Working with our partner organization to scale our market insights and naming to set up our partners for success and create excitement for new partner offerings that fill the areas of market need and new trends we identify. Writing! Logophiles wanted. Much of what we do requires some intellectual horsepower, and the patience and persistence needed to understand esoteric topics, build a working knowledge of it, and then write about it in a way that is easily understood by a larger audience and quickly communicates to the reader on why they should care. Ensures that content you create is fully “launched” both inside and outside FICO to maximize its impact. This requires excellent communication (written, verbal and visual), the ability to provide informal or formal training, evangelization, and diligent follow up with stakeholders to ensure the organization is aware of and actively consumes these materials in their campaigns and sales processes. Systems thinking and creativity. We work in a complex problem space that will require you to understand the people, process and technology at FICO and how it all fits together. It will also require you to invent new ideas and new approaches to “get things done” within the FICO culture, as well as strong project management to see things through to completion. A desire to learn from our more senior marketers and technical experts. We have smart folks who are happy to help get you unstuck, to serve as subject matter experts, a sounding board, and mentor and coach you on your journey. What We're Seeking Some level of product, platform or solution experience with a technology company. This might be in product marketing, but could also be in related areas such as product management, professional services, data science, architecture, technical writing, UX, sales, or other role. BA/BS in a related field with bonus points for a master’s degree. The major is less important to us than is your ability to tell a good story about how your education and knowledge has shaped how you approach solving problems and will enable you to be successful here. An example of a research or naming project that you led or contributed to. Loves hands on technical work and is a “doer” with a track record of producing results. Extra Credit: #favorite marketing journal, blog, technical resource or book on your resume. Our Offer to You An inclusive culture strongly reflecting our core values: Act Like an Owner, Delight Our Customers and Earn the Respect of Others. The opportunity to make an impact and develop professionally by leveraging your unique strengths and participating in valuable learning experiences. Highly competitive compensation, benefits and rewards programs that encourage you to bring your best every day and be recognized for doing so. An engaging, people first work environment offering work/life balance, employee resource groups, and social events to promote interaction and camaraderie. The targeted base pay range for this role is: $112,000 to $176,000 with this range reflecting differences in candidate knowledge, skills and experience. Why Make a Move to FICO? At FICO, you can develop your career with a leading organization in one of the fastest growing fields in technology today – Big Data analytics. You’ll play a part in our commitment to help businesses use data to improve every choice they make, using advances in artificial intelligence, machine learning, optimization, and much more. FICO makes a real difference in the way businesses operate worldwide: Credit Scoring — FICO® Scores are used by 90 of the top 100 US lenders. Fraud Detection and Security — 4 billion payment cards globally are protected by FICO fraud systems. Lending — 3/4 of US mortgages are approved using the FICO Score. Global trends toward digital transformation have created tremendous demand for FICO’s solutions, placing us among the world’s top 100 software companies by revenue. We help many of the world’s largest banks, insurers, retailers, telecommunications providers and other firms reach a new level of success. Our success is dependent on really talented people – just like you – who thrive on the collaboration and innovation that’s nurtured by a diverse and inclusive environment. We’ll provide the support you need, while ensuring you have the freedom to develop your skills and grow your career. Join FICO and help change the way business thinks! Learn more about how you can fulfil your potential at www.fico.com/Careers FICO promotes a culture of inclusion and seeks to attract a diverse set of candidates for each job opportunity. We are an equal employment opportunity employer and we’re proud to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all candidates without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. Research has shown that women and candidates from underrepresented communities may not apply for an opportunity if they don’t meet all stated qualifications. While our qualifications are clearly related to role success, each candidate’s profile is unique and strengths in certain skill and/or experience areas can be equally effective. If you believe you have many, but not necessarily all, of the stated qualifications we encourage you to apply. Information submitted with your application is subject to the FICO Privacy policy at https://www.fico.com/en/privacy policy show less
